article.title: Single image depth estimation by dilated deep residual convolutional neural network and soft-weight-sum inference

multiple_choice_question.text: What does "/2" represent in the context of the convolutional and pooling layers in the network architecture?
choices: The layer\'s dilation rate is 2.
The layer\'s kernel size is halved.
The layer\'s stride is 2.
The layer\'s output channels are halved.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which layers are indicated as implementing the skip connection structure?
choices: L1, L6
3x3, max pool

multiple_choice_question.text: What does "xn" signify in the context of the residual blocks?
choices: The number of input channels to the block.
The scaling factor for the number of filters in the block.
The block repeats n times.
The dilation rate for the convolutional layers within the block.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the diagonal dominant structure in Figure 2b (confusion matrix) indicate about the model\'s predictions?
choices: The model frequently predicts depths far from the ground truth.
The model\'s predicted depth tends to be centralized around the correct label.
The model is highly sensitive to noise in the input image.
The model struggles to differentiate between similar depth values.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend can be observed in the \'Pixel-wise accuracy\' and \'Rel\' values as the number of discretization bins increases?
choices: Both Pixel-wise accuracy and Rel decrease.
Pixel-wise accuracy increases while Rel decreases.
Pixel-wise accuracy decreases while Rel remains relatively stable.
Both Pixel-wise accuracy and Rel increase.
